hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via ETH/BTC Breakout with On-Chain Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, if the ETH/BTC ratio breaks above its 20-day resistance on >90th percentile volume, coinciding with a rise in Ethereum network active addresses (7-day MA up >10% WoW) and positive funding rates, the broader market will transition to a BULL regime within 5-7 days, led by altcoin rotation.
hypothesis_content.rationale: ETH/BTC is a key risk-on indicator. A breakout with high volume and on-chain growth signals capital rotation from BTC to higher-beta assets, reflecting increased risk appetite. Positive funding confirms speculative long interest. This combination often precedes broad market bullish momentum.
entry_conditions: Ethereum active addresses (7-day MA) up >10% week-over-week
Aggregate perpetual funding rate turns positive (>0.005%)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio falls back below the 20-day breakout level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the ETH/BTC breakout is a false move (quick reversal below resistance) and on-chain activity stagnates or declines, failing to generate broader market momentum.
